intro: Manulea ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf manulea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
